SEARCH
Package view.SWING

Class GraphicalUI

java.lang.Object
view.SWING.GraphicalUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI, View
public class GraphicalUI extends Object implements View, UI
This class represents a Graphical User Interface (GUI) for a view implementation. It implements the View and UI interfaces.

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphicalUI

      public GraphicalUI()
      Constructs a new instance of the GraphicalUI class. This constructor initializes the GraphicalUI by creating a new MainFrame object and setting the flaginitdone variable to 0.

  • Method Details

    • retrieveImages

      public File retrieveImages(String path, int type, int instantClose)

    • initGame

      public void initGame()
      Initializes the game by setting up the user interface and creating necessary components. This method creates and configures internal frames, panels, buttons, and images required for the game. It also sets the positions, sizes, and content of these components within the main frame.
      Specified by:
      initGame in interface View

    • endGame

      public void endGame(String esito)
      Ends the game and displays the game result in the user interface. This method sets the game result in the status label and opens a new JFrame to display the result.
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface View
      Parameters:
      esito - The result of the game.

    • showMatchInfo

      public void showMatchInfo(Tile[][] copy, List<CommonGoals> commonGoals, Tile[][] myShelf, PersonalGoal pg)
      Displays the match information in the user interface. This method prints the dashboard, common goals, personal goal, and shelf in the UI. If the game initialization has not been done yet, it performs the initialization.
      Specified by:
      showMatchInfo in interface View
      Parameters:
      copy - The copy of the game dashboard to be displayed.
      commonGoals - The list of common goals to be displayed.
      myShelf - The copy of the player's shelf to be displayed.
      pg - The player's personal goal to be displayed.

    • printPersonalGoal

      public void printPersonalGoal(PersonalGoal pg)
      Prints the personal goal card image to be displayed in the user interface. This method loads the image and sets it as the content pane of the personal goal panel. If the image has already been displayed once, it won't be reloaded.
      Specified by:
      printPersonalGoal in interface View
      Parameters:
      pg - The personal goal card to be displayed.

    • shownewMex

      public void shownewMex()
      Displays a new message in the user interface. This method is typically called when a new message is received.
      Specified by:
      shownewMex in interface View

    • showGameChat

      public void showGameChat(List<GameMessage> listToDisplay)
      Displays the game chat by showing the provided list of game messages.
      Specified by:
      showGameChat in interface View
      Parameters:
      listToDisplay - the list of game messages to be displayed in the game chat

    • printDashboard

      public void printDashboard(Tile[][] copy)
      Prints the dashboard with the provided tile configuration.
      Specified by:
      printDashboard in interface View
      Parameters:
      copy - the 2D array representing the tile configuration on the dashboard where copy[row][column] represents the tile at the specified position with row and column starting from 1

    • printShelf

      public void printShelf(Tile[][] myShelf)
      Prints the shelf with the provided tile configuration.
      Specified by:
      printShelf in interface View
      Parameters:
      myShelf - the 2D array representing the tile configuration on the shelf where myShelf[row][column] represents the tile at the specified position with row and column starting from 0

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the game. This method is called when the game starts to perform any necessary initialization tasks. Implementations of this method can be used to set up game resources, initialize variables, or perform any other initialization logic.
      Specified by:
      init in interface View

    • printCommonGoal

      public void printCommonGoal(List<CommonGoals> commonGoals)
      Displays the common goals on the user interface. This method takes a list of common goals and loads the corresponding images from the resources. The images are resized to the desired dimensions and displayed on the user interface using JLabels. The previous common goals and scoring tokens are removed from the panel, and the new images are added.
      Specified by:
      printCommonGoal in interface View
      Parameters:
      commonGoals - The list of common goals to display.

    • displayPoints

      public void displayPoints(int myPoint, int myPGpoints)
      Displays the current points for the player. This method calculates the sum of the player's points and personal goal points, and updates the label on the user interface to show the total score.
      Specified by:
      displayPoints in interface UI
      Parameters:
      myPoint - The player's points.
      myPGpoints - The player's personal goal points.

    • askConnection

      public int askConnection()
      Prompts the user to choose a connection method (RMI or SOCKET) using a graphical user interface. This method displays a panel with buttons representing the connection options. The user can click on a button to select the desired connection method. Once the user's choice is collected, it returns the chosen connection method as an integer.
      Specified by:
      askConnection in interface UI
      Returns:
      The chosen connection method: - 1 for RMI - 2 for SOCKET

    • askNickname

      public String askNickname()
      Prompts the user to enter their nickname using a graphical user interface. This method displays a panel with a label asking the user to insert their nickname, along with a text field where the user can enter their nickname. The user can press Enter or click outside the text field to submit their nickname. Once the user's nickname is collected, it returns the entered nickname as a string.
      Specified by:
      askNickname in interface UI
      Returns:
      The entered nickname as a string.

    • askNewGame

      public boolean askNewGame()
      Prompts the user to select between starting a new game or joining an existing game using a graphical user interface. This method displays a panel with buttons representing the options "NEW GAME" and "JOIN GAME". The user can click on a button to make their selection. Once the user's choice is collected, it returns a boolean value indicating whether to start a new game or join an existing game.
      Specified by:
      askNewGame in interface UI
      Returns:
      `true` if the user selects "NEW GAME", indicating a new game should be started. `false` if the user selects "JOIN GAME", indicating they want to join an existing game.

    • askNumberOfPlayers

      public int askNumberOfPlayers()
      Prompts the user to select the number of players using a graphical user interface. This method displays a panel with buttons representing different numbers of players. The user can click on a button to select the desired number of players. Once the user's choice is collected, it returns the selected number of players.
      Specified by:
      askNumberOfPlayers in interface UI
      Returns:
      The selected number of players.

    • askNumberOfTiles

      public int askNumberOfTiles()
      Prompts the user to enter the number of tiles they want to draw using a graphical user interface. This method displays an input dialog box and validates the user's input. It ensures that the input is a valid number between 1 and 3, and returns the selected number.
      Specified by:
      askNumberOfTiles in interface UI
      Returns:
      The number of tiles selected by the user.

    • askTilesToPick

      public List<Integer> askTilesToPick(int numberOfTile)
      Prompts the user to select tiles by interacting with a graphical user interface. This method waits for the user's selection by monitoring the status of a dashboard listener. Once the user's choice is collected, it returns a list of selected tile positions.
      Specified by:
      askTilesToPick in interface UI
      Parameters:
      numberOfTile - The number of tiles required to be picked.
      Returns:
      A list of selected tile positions.

    • askColumn

      public int askColumn()
      Prompts the user to select a column by interacting with a graphical user interface. This method waits for the user's selection by monitoring the status of a shelf listener. Once the user's choice is collected, it returns the selected column position.
      Specified by:
      askColumn in interface UI
      Returns:
      The selected column position.

    • getClicked

      public boolean getClicked()
      Gets the state of the refresh button click.
      Specified by:
      getClicked in interface UI
      Returns:
      True if the refresh button was clicked, false otherwise.

    • askIP

      public String askIP()
      Asks the user to input an IP address.
      Specified by:
      askIP in interface UI
      Returns:
      The IP address provided by the user.

    • pressAnyKey

      public boolean pressAnyKey()
      Indicates if any key is pressed.
      Specified by:
      pressAnyKey in interface UI
      Returns:
      Always returns true.
